Asian Businesses to Support in Berlin

01 April 2020 - 5 mins read time
Tags: Berlin POC Food

The Berlin Asian Food map was last updated 28 August, 2020.

Contribute: You can submit restaurants or new takeout/delivery options in this document: https://hackmd.io/C7UtXN8vTHqt2LWLamc3rw.

You can also contact me on Twitter or Instagram. Thanks!

This is a regularly updated map of Asian restaurants and groceries in Berlin. It is categorised by country pins to roughly highlight the cuisine focus.

You can find it at https://tinyurl.com/berlinasianfood.

Directory begins here

Being Asian may be an identity or an experience a based on how we look. Asia spreads from Turkey through the Middle East, over to Japan, and down the Asia Pacific reaching towards Australia. In reality, it is a region that has virtually every shade of skin, and too many languages and dishes to count.

Whether you are new to Berlin or have grown up in the city, if you identify as Asian, broadly defined, you are welcome in this community.

Since January, Asians have been experiencing much more racism and discrimination. Business is tough as it is, but Asian businesses will suffer doubly. Whatever your background, if you are going to #SupportYourLocal businesses, please seek out Asian ones to support as well. Thank you!

Asian grocery stores are still open

Please go support these places or your neighbourhood corner shop! These places are still open (and likely many more):

  • Go Asia: Online orders and the stores are still open! Also check their Facebook page for updates
  • Vinh-Lo
  • Asia24 in Dong Xuan Centre: A massive grocery store with staples for every type of Asian home cooking (from Indian to Japanese)
  • Asia-Markt Kopenhagener Str.: Well stocked for most Asian basics
  • Asia Mekong
  • Asia Market Lee & Google Maps

Restaurants

Like many other businesses in Berlin, a number of restaurants or catering businesses are offering delivery, takeout, or vouchers. Please consider ordering from these places so they can survive and re-open after Covid-19 passes. Also check out Berlin Asian Food for inspiration. Below are some eateries to get you going, but the map above has 150+ entries.

Pan-Asian

  • Easy Cook Asia: Prepared ingredients to cook at home
  • Zoom Fresh: Home cooking packages
  • Leha - Asia: By Südkreuz Station
  • Shisho Burger: Asian burgers on Kantstr.

Chinese

  • Chungking Noodles: Sichuan noodles
  • Mayflower 五月花: General
  • Shan Shan: Chinese
  • Shaniu’s House of Noodles 傻妞面館: Chinese
  • CozyMazu: Taiwanese
  • Dosha Teehaus: Taiwanese
  • Bubble Bauch - Tea Art Cafe: Taiwanese
  • Lao Xiang中餐厅: General
  • Dr.To’s: Chinese & Japanese
  • Ulteamate Berlin: Bubbletea

Japanese

  • Hako Prenzlauerberg: Ramen
  • Gohantokyotogo: Bistro
  • Café Komine: Japanese pastries and sweets
  • Tenzan: Kakigori shop now doing bentos as well

Korean

  • Fräulein Kimchi: Korean
  • Son Kitchen
  • Gokan Berlin
  • Juki
  • Korean Food Stories
  • Seoul Garden Near Savignyplatz is still doing Lieferando
  • Ixthys: Korean

Vietnamese

  • Bat Viet (Vietnamese, mom&pop): Vietnamese Takeout
  • VietPho in Dong Xuan Center: Vietnamese
  • Pho Noodlebar Xberg: Vietnamese
  • LaVong: Vietnamese Phojito

Thai

  • Khaotaan Berlin: Thai
  • Li.Ke Thai: Vegan Thai
  • Kin Dee: Thai
  • Papaya in Kantstrasse: Thai (Menu here)
  • Mae Charoen Thai Imbiss: Thai
  • Papaya at Winterfeldt Platz: Thai

Southeast Asian: Malaysian, Singaporean, Filipino, Indonesian, and General

Once communities grow to over 5 entries, they will be split into a separate section. This is for easier regional grouping and restaurants that serve more than one type of cuisine.

  • Seri Melayu - Halal: Malaysian
  • Ma-Makan: Singaporean & Malaysian
  • Small-batch Kaya from Pinch: Singaporean
  • Ayan: Filipino
  • Pinoy: Filipino
  • Nusantara Restaurant: Indonesian, halal, delivery, takeout, lieferando
  • Tuk Tuk: Indonesian, Halal

South Asian: South / North Indian, Pakistani, Sri Lankan:

  • Mama Shabz: Pakistani home and street food Rani: Indian
  • Lion Superfoods: Natural South Asian dried snacks direct from farmers in Sri Lanka
  • Many more on Google Maps!

Home Products

Binuyo: Natural, vegan soaps

  • IG: @Binuyo_Berlin

I’d like to build out a list of Asian freelancers and artists. If you know of any, please let me know!

Additional startups & businesses

When Covid-19 is over, I will re-organise the list again into online and offline companies. For now, I am leaving companies that are not serving F&B in this section as many place are closed.

  • Twindly
  • Loop Matters
  • EyeEm
  • Sprachinstitut Berlin: Deutschkurse & Englischkurse in Berlin-Mitte
  • HardSkills
  • Setting.io – Co-working Space

Creatives

I’d like to build out a list of Asian freelancers and artists. If you know of any, please let me know!

  • Stephanie Mazagg Comics Illustrations
  • Hong Le Instagram
  • Rice and Shine Podcast

Below are two zines outside of Germany that might be nice to read through:

  • Bitter Melon Covid Diary
  • Recipes for Resistance by Migrants Zine Collective

Business support networks

If you are an Asian business owner, please request access to the Asian Founders Dinner Berlin Facebook group.

To build a community network and support system, the Asian Founders Dinner began in 2018 by co-hosts: Makoto Takeda, Co-founder, BiStream Minchul Lee, Co-founder, EasyCook Asia

Other entrepreneur networks to check out

  • Vietnam Startup Network in Europe
  • German Accelerator Southeast Asia
  • Startup Asia Berlin
  • CityMakers Accelerator Program
  • EPRIE Program (arts and cultural focus)
with by Athena Lam
